content: This is an awesome post Mark Suster and one that really hits home! As a CEO I find myself asking my team and my board if we’re doing the right thing whilst being absolutely convinced we are. Every opportunity, every piece of PR, every speaking opporunity we ask ourselves — what is the end goal? What are we trying to achieve and how does this help us on our way? Why is it a stepping stone to our goal? In my world a conference is where you go to a) meet customer b) learn. Deals have got to be the right deals that move the business forward; customers have got to be the right customers. I think the hardest thing is not reacting to competitors — “Oh shit” moments happen and you need the self-belief in the vision and the team to ensure you constantly stay true to that goal and not load what the competition do disrupt that journey; unless of course it’s a truly disruptive event when non-action becomes a problem. To bastardise one of my favourite posts of yours — if you know where you are you know what goal is you follow the line and don’t get distracted by the dots!
